tweets.text: Flood Prevention Conference today, very relevant with  Story Christoph on the way.  Session one chaired by Andrew Woodliffe of @WatermanAspen1 with Julie Foley @EnvAgency, Conor Price @HawickFPS, Zane Gunton @CoastalP_UK  #FloodPrevention #PlaceMaking #Consultation #Community https://t.co/ebAiCUSBKB

Know what to do in a flood and check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7Fwblnq  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/MaE7ptFod2

Being prepared and knowing what to do in a #flood can reduce damage to your home and possessions by around 40%.

Find out what to do when you receive a flood warning and download our simple flood plan - https://t.co/vkHcHO9ADQ https://t.co/B44JQTpjSD

The difference between this and other storms that we've seen is that it will be lasting a few days - so the rain will come down over a longer period, rather than all at once, and the snow will melt too. Many river levels were high before this storm, so flooding is likely... (4/8)

There are a number of flood warnings in place across England, with heavy rainfall expected in the next few days.

By knowing what to do in a #flood, you can reduce the impacts to your home, family and possessions.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY 

#StormCristoph https://t.co/FMPUiziILV

#DoYouKnow what to do in flood?

tweets.text: We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

tweets.text:
So all that crap that washes off roads and into rivers polluting them, rubber, brake dust, oil, exhausts, petrol, diesel, etc.

Well appears the @EncAgency has the power to make ever Local Authority apply for a permit and put a stop to it. 

Guess what?

https://t.co/WrQ6I0DaJ8

Water off @ShrewsSchool #hodgson Hall has now seriously damaged the access road bank to @theriversevern towards @PengwernRowing @ShrewsRegatta through #becksfield #shrewsbury - @shropcouncil @shrewsburytc @EnvAgency @ShrewsburyChron @shropshirestar

tweets.text: Ahead of heavy rainfall expected on Tuesday and Wednesday due to Storm Christoph, JBA's @floodforesight is forecasting the potential for flooding across northern England, coinciding with @metoffice and @EnvAgency warnings. We'll continue to monitor the event as it unfolds. https://t.co/5poKvPBnKZ
Storm Christoph will batter us from today, bringing two months of rain in just 36 hours.  So keep an eye on @EnvAgencyMids for flooding information.

tweets.text:
I was supposed to be meeting @EnvAgencyYNE tomorrow but rearranging to allow staff to prepare for #StormChristoph 
Please see the useful guidance below, sign up for flood alerts in your area & stay safe https://t.co/Gvbw5BVPGJ

Flood alerts are still in place for the Upper and Lower River Calder due to the heavy rain forecast today and over the next few days.

We're prepared to respond to any flooding and we're continuing to clear drainage infrastructure. Please be prepared to follow your flood plan üíö https://t.co/skfPpFa4xV

One of my favourite #CitrixWorkspace microapps just burst into life with the onset of #StormChristoph The feed from @EnvAgency has kicked off lots of notifications. This could be a really useful feed for lots of people. Easy to configure too! https://t.co/y0WS81xk9E

Devastating report confirms the dreadful state of the Cam and its chalk stream tributaries but water companies and @EnvAgency escape blame. (Not surprisingly given Cambridge Water co-commissioned it) @CamLabEF   @greenarteries  @CPRECambs @Feargal_Sharkey  https://t.co/tbBkUTPpnN

Don't drive through #Flood water. 

#StormChristoph will cause large puddles on the roads and the risk of flooding

Don't get trapped in your car. Only an egg cup full of water in the engine can stop it working.

Turn around, don't drown!
@EnvAgency https://t.co/wm7ITgct6M
